This isn't just a trip—it's an odyssey, a powerful testament to your resilience, determination, and spirit. Every kilometer you cover, every lift you get, every smile you share is creating ripples of positivity far beyond what you can see. You're inspiring thousands of hearts, Rounak. People watching your journey aren’t just viewers—they're fellow dreamers who find strength in your adventure. Even at this low point, remember you're not alone. Your viewers, your family, your friends—we’re all with you, cheering, hoping, and believing in your dream.
The toughest days of your journey are shaping you, testing your limits and revealing who you truly are. Hold onto this truth: the most meaningful adventures aren’t the ones without hurdles, but those where the hurdles teach you to fly higher.
You’re on a mission bigger than yourself. You're not just crossing a map; you're bridging lives, cultures, and stories. Push through this low moment because the sunrise waiting for you at the end of this journey will be unforgettable. It will illuminate not just the path behind you but also the infinite possibilities ahead.

My take on your videos - In India, you will find 1 out of 10 people of helping nature. If you tried this abroad, such things will be very difficult, even your favorite London.
.
Also, an average Indian can easily identify you as a person from a good family, so they won't mind helping you out. From your body, your dressing sense, your cameras, you look as upper middle class person to those who don't know you. That would be another advantage. In North and West India, when you talk in English to hotels/hostels or any other services, the language would give you an edge.
.
You look innocent. So, best wishes for your journey.
